oai_dc:dc.dc:title: THE BROAD APPLICATION OF A DEPTH INVERSION ALGORITHM BASED ON THE DYNAMIC MODE DECOMPOSITION
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Gawehn, Matthijs
Vries, Sierd de
Aarninkhof, Stefan
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The technological boost of drones and satellites offers new and more flexible platforms for video-based depth inversion. It signals a desire to generate depth estimates on-the-fly, requiring more flexibility and high computational speeds. For this purpose, a novel algorithm was developed, which is based on the Dynamic Mode Decomposition. The analysis of video from three different field-sites in the Netherlands, Australia and US, suggests that 32 s of video are sufficient to correctly capture the significant wave components in the wave-field. It means that DMD-based depth inversion is suited for fast coastal reconnaissance.Recorded Presentation from the vICCE (YouTube Link): https://youtu.be/TcE13C1oTKw
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 36v (2020): Proceedings of virtual Conference on Coastal Engineering, 2020; waves.50
